data.name: Shortest string
data.description:
Given data and keys, you have to return the shortest part of data that contains all the keys. For example:
data = 'abccXa1AbYc2baZaac'
keys = 'abca' The result can be one of them:
Version 1: 'abccXa'
Version 2: 'c2baZa'
Version 3: 'baZaac' Ask why? here the reason:
The character 'a' found twice in keys, so 'a' should be found twice or more in your result.
The character 'b' found once in keys, so 'b' should be found once or more in your result.
The character 'c' found once in keys, so 'c' should be found once or more in your result. There are lots of possible combinations, you don't believe me? what about this one 'a1AbYc2ba'?
The character 'a' found twice. (Well, that explains: 'A' != 'a')
The character 'b' found twice.
The character 'c' found once. We don't take this answer because the question asks for the shortest one!
Importent notes:
• The data contains the characters: (0-9), (a-z), (A-Z).
• When there is no solution, return None as default.
• There are 1000 random test cases, you have to solve all of them in 1 second. The idea behind "1 second to solve 1000 test cases" is avoid from brute-force algorithms, each test case generates data between 100-300 characters and keys between 5-10 characters. Good luck everyone ;)
